section.title: Looking up GeoIP data from IP addresses (DEPRECATED)
section.para: This parser is deprecated. Use instead.

The &abbrev; application can lookup IPv4 addresses from an offline GeoIP database, and make the retrieved data available in name-value pairs. IPv6 addresses are not supported. Depending on the database used, you can access country code, longitude, and latitude information.

note.para: To access longitude and latitude information, download the GeoLiteCity database, and unzip it (for example, to the /usr/share/GeoIP/GeoLiteCity.dat file). The default databases available on Linux and other platforms usually contain only the country codes.

section.para: You can refer to the separated parts of the message using the key of the value as a macro. For example, if the message contains KEY1=value1,KEY2=value2, you can refer to the values as ${KEY1} and ${KEY2}.

section.title: Options of geoip parsers
section.para: The geoip parser has the following options.

simplesect.para: For example, to insert the geoip. prefix, use the prefix(.geoip.) option. To refer to a particular data when using a prefix, use the prefix in the name of the macro, for example, ${geoip.country_code} .

simplesect.title: database()
simplesect.para: Description: The full path to the GeoIP database to use. Note that &abbrev; must have the required privileges to read this file. Do not modify or delete this file while &abbrev; is running, it can crash &abbrev;.
